definitions.definition: To extinguish the courage of; to dishearten ; to depress the spirits of; to deprive of confidence ; to deject .
examples: Don't be discouraged by the amount of work left to do: you'll finish it in good time.

definitions.definition: To persuade somebody not to do (something).

main_definition: ( transitive ) To extinguish the courage of; to dishearten ; to depress the spirits of; to deprive of confidence ; to deject .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To persuade somebody not to do (something).
